label: Contacted elected official
w2_wording: Have you ever contacted an elected official to express your views? (broad)
w3_wording: Have you ever contacted an elected official to complain about or seek help with a problem? (narrow)
w4_wording: Have you ever contacted an elected official to express your views? (broad)
w6_wording: Have you ever contacted an elected official to express your views? (broad)
notes: W3 uses problem-motivated framing; W2↔W3 and W3↔W4 comparisons invalid. W2, W4, W6 comparable.

label: Contacted civil servant
w2_wording: Have you ever contacted a civil servant to express your views? (broad)
w3_wording: Have you ever contacted a government official to complain about or seek help with a problem? (narrow)
w4_wording: Have you ever contacted a civil servant to express your views? (broad)
w6_wording: Have you ever contacted a civil servant to express your views? (broad)
notes: W3 uses problem-motivated framing; W2↔W3 and W3↔W4 comparisons invalid. W2, W4, W6 comparable.

label: Contacted influential person
w2_wording: Have you ever contacted a person of influence? (broad)
w3_wording: Have you ever contacted a person of influence? (broad)
w4_wording: Have you ever contacted a person of influence? (broad)
w6_wording: Have you ever contacted a person of influence? (broad)
notes: Consistent broad framing across all waves. Recommended for cross-wave participation comparisons.

label: Signed petition
w2_wording: Not collected in W2
w3_wording: Have you ever signed a petition? (consistent)
w4_wording: Have you ever signed a petition? (consistent)
w6_wording: Have you ever signed a petition? (consistent)
notes: W2 not collected. W3/W4/W6 comparable.

label: Attended demonstration
w2_wording: Have you ever attended a demonstration or protest march? (consistent)
w3_wording: Have you ever attended a demonstration or protest march? (consistent)
w4_wording: Have you ever attended a demonstration or protest march? (consistent)
w6_wording: Have you ever attended a demonstration or protest march? (consistent)
notes: Consistent wording across all four waves.

label: Contacted media
w2_wording: Have you ever contacted the media to express your views? (consistent)
w3_wording: Have you ever contacted the media to express your views? (consistent)
w4_wording: Have you ever contacted the media to express your views? (consistent)
w6_wording: Have you ever contacted the media to express your views? (consistent)
notes: Consistent wording across all four waves.

label: Community leader contact
w2_wording: How often do you contact community leaders? (1–5 frequency)
w3_wording: How often do you contact community leaders? (1–5 frequency)
w4_wording: How often do you contact community leaders? (1–5 frequency)
w6_wording: How often do you contact community leaders? (1–5 frequency)
notes: Consistent scale and wording across all waves.

label: Voted in last election
w2_wording: Did you vote in the last national election? (binary)
w3_wording: Did you vote in the last national election? (binary)
w4_wording: Did you vote in the last national election? (binary)
w6_wording: Did you vote in the last national election? (binary)
notes: Consistent across all waves. Note: reference election differs by wave (2003/2008/2013/2018).

label: Expert rule
w2_wording: Not collected in W2
w3_wording: Should experts rather than government make decisions? (1–4)
w4_wording: Should experts rather than government make decisions? (1–4)
w6_wording: Should experts rather than government make decisions? (1–4)
notes: W2 not collected. W3/W4/W6 comparable on identical 1–4 scale.

label: Single-party rule
w2_wording: Should only one political party be allowed to contest elections? (1–4)
w3_wording: Should only one political party be allowed to contest elections? (1–4)
w4_wording: Should only one political party be allowed to contest elections? (1–4)
w6_wording: Should only one political party be allowed to contest elections? (1–4)
notes: Consistent 1–4 scale ('very bad' to 'very good') across all waves.

label: Strongman rule
w2_wording: Should we get rid of parliament and elections for a strong leader? (1–4)
w3_wording: Should we get rid of parliament and elections for a strong leader? (1–4)
w4_wording: Should we get rid of parliament and elections for a strong leader? (1–4)
w6_wording: Should we get rid of parliament and elections for a strong leader? (1–4)
notes: Consistent 1–4 scale across all waves.

label: Military rule
w2_wording: Should the military rule the country? (1–4)
w3_wording: Should the military rule the country? (1–4)
w4_wording: Should the military rule the country? (1–4)
w6_wording: Should the military rule the country? (1–4)
notes: Consistent 1–4 scale across all waves.

label: Democratic future (0-10)
w2_wording: Not collected in W2
w3_wording: How democratic will this country be in 10 years? (0–10)
w4_wording: How democratic will this country be in 10 years? (0–10)
w6_wording: How democratic will this country be in 10 years? (0–10)
notes: W2 not collected. W3/W4/W6 comparable on identical 0–10 scale.

label: Democratic past (0-10)
w2_wording: Not collected in W2
w3_wording: How democratic was this country 10 years ago? (0–10)
w4_wording: How democratic was this country 10 years ago? (0–10)
w6_wording: How democratic was this country 10 years ago? (0–10)
notes: W2 not collected. W3/W4/W6 comparable.

label: Democratic present (0-10)
w2_wording: How democratic is this country today? (partial coverage, W2)
w3_wording: How democratic is this country today? (0–10 scale, government performance framing)
w4_wording: How democratic is this country today? (0–10 scale, government performance framing)
w6_wording: How democratic is this country today? (0–10 scale, government performance framing)
notes: W2 has ~53% nonresponse; low confidence on W2 estimate. W3/W4/W6 comparable.

label: Witnessed corruption (binary)
w2_wording: Has any government official asked you for a bribe? (binary W2)
w3_wording: Have you or anyone in your family personally experienced or witnessed government corruption? (broader)
w4_wording: Have you or anyone in your family personally experienced or witnessed government corruption?
w6_wording: Have you or anyone in your family personally experienced or witnessed government corruption?
notes: W2 wording is narrower (bribe solicitation only); W3–W6 use broader witnessed/experienced framing. W2↔W3 comparison should be treated with caution.

label: National govt corruption
w2_wording: How widespread is corruption in national government? (1–4)
w3_wording: How widespread is corruption in national government? (1–4)
w4_wording: How widespread is corruption in national government? (1–4)
w6_wording: How widespread is corruption in national government? (1–4)
notes: Consistent 1–4 scale across all waves.

label: Local govt corruption
w2_wording: How widespread is corruption in local government? (1–4)
w3_wording: How widespread is corruption in local government? (1–4)
w4_wording: How widespread is corruption in local government? (1–4)
w6_wording: How widespread is corruption in local government? (1–4)
notes: Consistent 1–4 scale across all waves.

label: Follows political news
w2_wording: How often do you follow political news? (1–5)
w3_wording: How often do you follow political news? (1–5)
w4_wording: How often do you follow political news? (1–5)
w6_wording: How often do you follow political news? (1–5)
notes: Consistent 1–5 scale across all waves.

label: Internet news (harmonized)
w2_wording: How often do you get news from internet? (6-point scale)
w3_wording: How often do you get news from internet? (6-point scale)
w4_wording: How often do you get news from internet? (8-point scale — harmonized to 6pt)
w6_wording: How often do you get news from internet? (9-point scale — harmonized to 6pt)
notes: Response scale differs across waves (6pt W2/W3, 8pt W4, 9pt W6). Harmonized to common 1–6 scale. Within-frequency comparisons (never vs. daily) valid; fine distinctions within daily use not comparable.

label: Political interest
w2_wording: How interested are you in politics? (1–4)
w3_wording: How interested are you in politics? (1–4)
w4_wording: How interested are you in politics? (1–4)
w6_wording: How interested are you in politics? (1–4)
notes: Consistent 1–4 scale across all waves.

label: Discusses politics
w2_wording: How often do you discuss politics with friends or family? (1–3)
w3_wording: How often do you discuss politics with friends or family? (1–3)
w4_wording: How often do you discuss politics with friends or family? (1–3)
w6_wording: How often do you discuss politics with friends or family? (1–3)
notes: Consistent 1–3 scale across all waves.
